posts.name: James
posts.cooked:
Our team wants to wire some kind of range sensor to detect algae. We are already using a break beam sensor with the Data Port Breakout Board. The way out robot is it would be difficult to wire another break beam.

Is there a way to use an analog senor where it trips at a certain distance? Like an ultrasonic sensor or similar? Thanks for the help!

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked:
We are doing this for our coral. We have a distance sensor wired as a reverse limit switch on the breakout board. We put slots on our intake and designed a bolted mount so we could adjust the distance. image 3024×4032 2.72 MB image 3024×4032 3.11 MB

image 3024×4032 2.72 MB

image 3024×4032 2.72 MB

image 3024×4032 3.11 MB

image 3024×4032 3.11 MB

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Awesome! How do you read if the sensor was tripped or not?

posts.name: Kevin
posts.cooked: (As far as I know) we just wired it in to the R and GND pads and then used the 5v power to power it. Then in code we just call SparkMax.getReverseLimitSwitch().isPressed() I believe, or whatever the proper method is in Java. You don’t have to enable it as a hard limit either, so you can still read the value even if you aren’t stopping the motor directly based off it.

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: That makes sense, I missed the “digital” part of the sensor

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: We found several analog sensor that we could use. Hoping to not have to buy another sensor right now. If anyone has any feedback on how to use an analog sensor it would be much appreciated!

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Are you able to connect an analog sensor like an ultrasonic sensor or time of flight sensor to the encoder pins of the data port breakout board and read the value output from that?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Also, we already have a break beam sensor connected to 5v, should we use 3.3v to avoid using too much current on one point?

posts.name: James
posts.cooked: Okay, I think I found the analog input pin. How do I configure the analog input with the SparkMAX configs?
